original: Your liege's guards have brought a Christian, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], to the big oak in front of the temple. As the noose is placed around [FromFrom.GetHerHis] neck, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] continues to prattle on about the Holy Spirit and how we shall all suffer in Hell for our sins... but soon [FromFrom.GetSheHe] speaks no more.
translation: 你领主的卫兵将一个基督徒——[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]——押往圣殿前的橡树旁，绞索已经套到了[FromFrom.GetHerHis]脖子上，即便到这时候了，[FromFrom.GetSheHe]依然在那里唠叨「圣灵」以及我们将在因罪恶而在所谓的地狱中受到惩罚……不过很快[FromFrom.GetSheHe]就不唠叨了。

original: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], a Mohammedan from your liege's dungeons, has been brought to the temple and will now be sacrificed to the gods. As the noose is placed around [FromFrom.GetHerHis] neck, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] quotes a passage from their holy book right up until the rope tightens and [FromFrom.GetHerHis] feet rise off the ground.
translation: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]，一个伊斯兰教徒，被从你领主的地牢中带出来，押往圣殿作为献给神的祭品。绞索已经套到了[FromFrom.GetHerHis]脖子上，[FromFrom.GetSheHe]还不断地念叨他们经书里的经文，直到绳子一紧，[FromFrom.GetHerHis]也随之「登霄」了。

original: Your liege has told [From.GetHerHis] men to fetch [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], [From.GetHerHis] own brother, from the dungeons. [From.GetFirstName] betrays no emotion as [FromFrom.GetFirstName] is brought up to the gallows in front of the temple, and soon his limp body can be seen slowly dangling back and forth in the wind.
translation: 你的领主命[From.GetHerHis]士兵将[From.GetHerHis]亲兄弟[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]从地牢里押了出来。在[FromFrom.GetFirstName]被押往神殿前的绞架时[From.GetFirstName]没有流露丝毫感情，很快他的尸体就在绞架上无力的摇曳起来。

original: It seems your liege has decided to sacrifice [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], [From.GetHerHis] own sister, to the gods. She has been brought out from [From.GetFirstName]'s dark dungeons, and while she squints her eyes in the unfamiliar daylight, the guards place a noose around her neck. Moments later her eyes are forever dead and listless.
translation: 你的领主决定把[From.GetHerHis]亲姐妹 [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]作为献给奥丁的牺牲。她从 [From.GetFirstName]的黑牢里被押了出来，她眯着眼睛看了下那久违的阳光时，卫兵已经将绞索套到了她的脖子上。片刻之后，死亡的浑浊永远充盈了她的眼睛。

original: To your surprise, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] orders [FromFrom.GetHerHis] guards to bring out [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] - [FromFrom.GetHerHis] own father. He is brought to the gallows in front of the temple, and soon he joins the others hanging limply from the branches with dead, gaping eyes.
translation: 出乎你的预料，[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]命令[FromFrom.GetHerHis]卫兵将[FromFrom.GetHerHis]父亲[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]押了出来。他被押往圣殿前的绞架，很快他就睁着空洞无光的眼神挂在了那里。

original: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], the mother of your liege, appears at the temple flanked by guards, and to your surprise they escort her right up to the gallows. She pleads in vain with [From.GetTitledFirstName], but [From.GetSheHe] will not be moved. Within moments, she dangles next to the other offerings in the trees outside the temple.
translation: 你领主的母亲[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]在卫兵的护送下来到神庙，出乎你意料的是她竟然被护送到了绞架上。她徒劳地向[From.GetTitledFirstName]乞求，但[From.GetSheHe]对此无动于衷。很快她就成了挂在神庙外树上的牺牲之一。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] marches [From.GetTitledHerHis] own son, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], to the gallows outside the temple. He is to be the next sacrifice. All of his pleas fall on deaf ears, and moments later the guards place the noose around his neck and he is made forever silent.
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]将[From.GetTitledHerHis]儿子[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]押到了圣殿前的绞刑架上。他是下一个祭品。他的哀求根本就没有得到任何回应，很快卫兵把绞索套到了他的脖子上，然后他就永远地安静了。

original: Those assembled at the blot gasp in surprise when [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], daughter of [From.GetTitledFirstName], is dragged up to the gallows for the next sacrifice. She asks her [From.GetFatherMother] for mercy, but none is forthcoming.
translation: 当[From.GetTitledFirstName]的女儿[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]为了下一次献祭被带到龙门架下时，聚集在献祭仪式前的人群都很惊讶。她向她的[From.GetFatherMother]请求宽恕，但是并没有人站出来。

original: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], a member of [From.GetFirstName]'s own extended family, is dragged from the dungeons and brought to the temple. Despite, or perhaps because of, the fact that they are of the same blood, [From.GetFirstName] shows no mercy and the sacrifice takes place as planned.
translation: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]，一位[From.GetFirstName]的远亲被从地牢押送到了神庙，即便有，或正是因为有血缘关系，[From.GetFirstName]仍然依照计划无情的牺牲了那亲戚。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has apparently decided to sacrifice [From.GetHerHis] own spouse, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], to the gods, and [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has been brought in chains to the temple. Despite professing [FromFrom.GetHerHis] continued love, [From.GetFirstName] has decided to go ahead with the sacrifice.
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]已经决定要将[From.GetHerHis]配偶[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]献祭给神灵。[FromFrom.GetSheHe]被人用锁链带到庙中。尽管配偶声称[FromFrom.GetHerHis]感情并没有消失，但[From.GetFirstName]仍然决定继续祭祀。

original: In honor of this blot, your liege produces a Skræling from deep within [From.GetHerHis] dungeons. [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is brought to the temple for the sacrifice, and everyone agrees that this is a most worthy sacrifice.
translation: 为了这次祭祀，你的领主从[From.GetHerHis]地牢中带出了一个「着皮者」。[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]被带到神庙中献祭，大家都认为这次的祭品非常的有价值。

original: As you have no prisoners languishing in your dungeons that are suitable for sacrifice at the blot, you are forced to make do with some randomly purchased thralls. They are brought to the big oak outside the temple, and soon their limp and lifeless bodies are hanging from its thick branches.
translation: 你的地牢里已经空空如也，没有适合献祭的犯人，于是你必须从购买的奴隶们之中选出几位，把他们带到神庙外的橡树旁。不久，他们的遗体就歪歪斜斜地吊在大树的枝桠上面了。

original: As [From.GetTitledFirstName] had no prisoners languishing in [From.GetHerHis] dungeons that were suitable for sacrifice at the blot, your liege was forced to make do with some randomly purchased thralls. They are brought to the big oak outside the temple, and soon their limp and lifeless bodies are hanging from its thick branches.
translation: 因为[From.GetTitledFirstName]在[From.GetHerHis]地牢没有合适的祭品，你的领主必须从买到的奴隶中随机挑选出来一些来作为代替品。他们被带到神庙外的橡树旁。不久，他们的遗体就歪歪斜斜地吊在大树的枝桠上面了。

original: As you stand trembling with the noose around your neck, [From.GetTitledFirstName] suddenly seems to have had a change of mind. The noose is removed and you are brought back to the dungeon. It looks like you will live to see another day.
translation: 正当你的脖子被套上项圈发抖的时候，[From.GetTitledFirstName]似乎突然改变了主意。项圈被拿了下来，你被拉回了地牢内。看起来你又能多活一天了。

original: With the sacrifice over, the feast at the end of the blot can now begin. The meat of the animals that were sacrificed has already been prepared, and there is plenty of mead to go around.
translation: 祭祀结束后宴会就可以开始了，一盘盘早就准备好的肉被端了上来。当然，宴会还准备了许多珍藏的蜂蜜酒。

original: The feast is over and with it the blot. It will be at least nine years until you hold the next one, but as your vassals return home, most seem to agree that the ceremony was well worth the trip.
translation: 宴会结束了，下次举行最少要等到九年后吧。毫无疑问整个仪式相当成功，你的封臣们回家后都表示不虚此行。

original: The feast is over and with it the blot. It will be at least nine years until your liege holds the next one, but as you and the other vassals return home, most seem to agree that the ceremony was well worth the trip.
translation: 宴会结束了，下次参加至少要等到九年后。当你和其他封臣回家之后，大部分人都同意整个祭祀仪式相当成功，真是不虚此行。

original: The mead and the spirits being served at the feast have gotten the better of you. You tried to be strong this time, and you did your best to stay away, but the pull was just too great...
translation: 宴会提供了上好的蜂蜜酒和烈酒，最对你的口味。你这次也想要顶住诱惑，尽了最大的力量让自己远离这些酒，可是吸引力实在是太大了……

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been drinking more and more since the feast began, and [From.GetSheHe] has now reached a point where [From.GetSheHe] he can no longer stand upright. Surrounded by empty tankards and singing at the top of [From.GetHerHis] lungs, you find [From.GetFirstName] lying on the table amidst the food.
translation: 自从宴会开始以来，[From.GetTitledFirstName]越喝越起劲，[From.GetSheHe]现在已经喝高了，站不起来了。[From.GetFirstName]身边全是空酒杯，并用[From.GetHerHis]最大音量唱歌，还躺在摆满食物的桌上。
嗝儿……我听……听过这首儿歌儿！

original: Your mouth waters as servants place tray after tray of food on the table, and when the other guests engage in conversation, the only sounds coming from your corner are grunts and burps as you begin stuffing yourself. A sudden nausea sets in and you hurry towards the exit, but only make it as far as the lap of [From.GetTitledFirstName]...
translation: 侍者们一碟接着一碟上菜，你的嘴巴也一直没有停。其他的客人一直在聊天，而你这边传出来的声音却只有吞咽的咕噜声和饱嗝。你突然感到一阵恶心，于是匆匆忙忙想离开，但是只爬到了[From.GetTitledFirstName]的腿旁……

original: Morsels of food and clean-picked bones fly everywhere from the direction of [From.GetTitledFirstName] as [From.GetSheHe] greedily stuffs [From.GetHerselfHimself] with the delicacies served at the table. Suddenly [From.GetHerHis] face turns a strange shade of green, and [From.GetSheHe] rushes towards the exit but only make it as far as your seat before [From.GetSheHe] starts retching [From.GetHerHis] stomach contents into your lap...
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName][From.GetSheHe]贪婪地将食物塞进胃里填饱[From.GetHerselfHimself]，把食物和剔净的骨头到处乱扔。突然间[From.GetHerHis]脸上出现了奇怪的绿色，[From.GetSheHe]直接冲向出口，却只来得及移动到了你的座位旁，然后[From.GetSheHe]将[From.GetHerHis]胃里的食物吐在你的腿上……
那条裤子是我最喜欢的！

original: Morsels of food and clean-picked bones fly everywhere from the direction of [From.GetTitledFirstName] as [From.GetSheHe] greedily stuffs [From.GetHerselfHimself] with the delicacies served at the table. Suddenly [From.GetHerHis] face turns a strange shade of green, and [From.GetSheHe] rushes towards the exit but only make it as far as [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] before [From.GetSheHe] starts retching [From.GetHerHis] stomach contents into poor [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s lap...
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName][From.GetSheHe]贪婪地将食物塞进胃里填饱[From.GetHerselfHimself]，把食物和剔净的骨头到处乱扔。突然间[From.GetHerHis]脸上出现了奇怪的绿色，[From.GetSheHe]直接冲向出口，却只来得及移动到了[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]的座位旁，然后[From.GetSheHe]将[From.GetHerHis]胃里的食物吐在[FromFrom.GetFirstName]的腿上……

original: As you enjoy the feast, you are struck by the warmth and kindness of those sitting next to you at the table. In fact, it's getting just a little too warm. You strip off your clothes and jump up on the table. Help, I'm on fire! you scream at the top of your lungs while waving your arms as the other bewildered guests look on.
translation: 当你享受你的晚宴之时，你的身边环绕的都是温暖而善良的人们。但这显得有点过于温暖了，你脱下了衣服，在桌上跳了起来。救命！我着火了！你用尽力气呼喊，挥舞着你的双臂，其他人还在一头雾水之中。

original: Put me out, put me out!

You are enjoying the feast when a shrill scream from the other end of the room suddenly draws your attention. Stark naked, [From.GetTitledFirstName] is running around on the table waving [From.GetHerHis] arms while screaming that [From.GetSheHe] is on fire. You groan and bury your face in your hands.
translation: 当你享受你的晚宴之时，房间的另一头突然传来一阵尖利的叫声，这吸引力了你的注意力。一丝不挂的[From.GetTitledFirstName]绕着桌子乱跑，挥舞着[From.GetHerHis]手臂，高呼[From.GetSheHe]着火了。你用手捂住了你的脸抱怨。

original: So [From.GetSheHe] is! And... and so am I! AAAHHH!
translation: [From.GetSheHe]着火了！而且……我也着火了！啊啊啊啊啊啊！

original: One of the serving girls has been eyeing you ever since you arrived at the feast, and now, fortified with mead, your hands grope at her body and she returns the favor. You pull off each other's clothes and give in to passion. Just as you join in her screams of pleasure, it dawns on you that you're doing this in full view of all the other stunned guests...
translation: 有一个侍女从你到场之后就一直在看着你。喝了许多酒之后，你的手抓住了她，她也回应了你。你们脱光了衣服，开始进行爱的互动。正当你愉悦的时候，你突然发现自己是在其他吓呆宾客的众目睽睽之下……

original: [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] will not be happy about this...

You are conversing with another guest when loud screams of passion interrupt. In one corner of the room, in full view of everyone else, [From.GetTitledFirstName] is engaged in carnal pleasures with one of the serving girls. Both are completely naked, and only when they notice the stunned silence in the room do they seem to remember where they are.
translation: 你和另外一位客人的谈话被奇怪的叫声打断了。在房间的另一头，众目睽睽之下，[From.GetTitledFirstName]正在和侍女沉浸于肉欲之中。二人赤身裸体，直到突然的可怕沉默提醒了他们……

original: Haha, you old dog! Nicely done!
You have been seated next to [From.GetTitledFirstName] for the duration of the feast, and you have found [From.GetHerHim] to be a most agreeable person. There seems to be much you have in common.
translation: 宴会中，你坐在[From.GetTitledFirstName]的身边，你发现[From.GetHerHim]是个很和蔼的人，你们似乎有很多共同点。

original: It would seem I have a new friend.

Your mind wanders as you sit at your table during the feast, when suddenly you lock eyes with [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Something about [From.GetHerHis] gaze seems to reach into your heart, and when [From.GetSheHe] steps outside for some fresh air, you quickly excuse yourself to join [From.GetHerHim].
translation: 席间你本来在神游，但突然间你盯上了[From.GetTitledFirstName]，[From.GetHerHis]目光吸引了你的注意力。[From.GetSheHe]想出去呼吸一下新鲜空气，于是你也说服自己跟了上去，走向[From.GetHerHim]。

original: I thought I was the only one...

You are locked in the embrace of your lover, and just as you kiss each other another guest wanders out of the feast hall and notices you. Though you immediately let go of each other, the damage is already done as the outraged guest rushes back inside to tell everyone what he saw.
translation: 你正在你的情人怀中，互相亲吻的时候，另一个客人从大厅中走出来闲逛，突然看到了你。尽管你们很快就分开来，后果已不可避免，被冒犯的客人已经冲回去告诉大家他所看到的一切。

original: It... it's not what it looks like!

With everything spinning from all the mead you drank, you stumble towards the exit to relieve yourself. As you step outside, you are treated to the sight of [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], embracing each other and kissing passionately. They immediately stop when they notice you.
translation: 你喝到感觉天旋地转，于是想出去呼吸呼吸新鲜空气。你一出门就看到[From.GetTitledFirstName]和[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]抱在一起相互亲吻。他们注意到了你，立即停了下来。
看在[This.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]的份上！你们……你们两个是……！

original: Oh, don't mind me. Carry on, friends.
translation: 哦，别管我。你们继续吧，朋友。
庆祝过乌日加维内斯节

original: Celebrate the coming of summer and pay tribute to Ukko, the god of weather and crops, by hosting the Ukon juhla festival.
translation: 举办乌戈节宴会以庆祝即将到来的夏天，向天空及谷物之神乌戈献上祭品。

original: You begin preparations for the Ukon juhla festival.\n
translation: 你开始着手准备乌戈节宴会。\n

original: Invitations have gone out to your vassals asking them to join you in this summer's Ukon juhla festival. You have decided to make the festival this year a special one, remembered by both gods and men for many years to come.
translation: 我们已经向封臣们发出了参加今年夏天乌戈节的邀请函。你希望让神灵和参加的宾客们都能在很多年内记住这次节日，这个宴会。

original: Invitation to the Ukon juhla festival is sent.
translation: 乌戈节的请柬已经送出去了。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] for this summer's Ukon juhla festival. There you will celebrate the coming of summer and pay tribute to Ukko, the god of weather and crops.
translation: 你的领主[From.GetTitledFirstName]邀请你去[From.GetHerHim]那里庆祝今年夏天的乌戈节。你将庆祝夏季的来临，向天空及谷物之神乌戈提供祭品。

original: I will have nothing to do with that nonsense!
translation: 这种没意思的活动我才不去呢！

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend the Ukon juhla festival! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in Ukko, Jumi and the other gods, and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]拒绝了你参加乌戈节的提议！很明显，[From.GetSheHe]根本就不相信乌戈，尤米以及其他的神灵，反而遵循与我们道路不相适应的某些其他宗教的奇怪仪式。

original: Your vassals have arrived and the time of the Ukon juhla festival is upon us. The night comes late during the summer months, but when darkness begins to set in the bonfires you have prepared light up the forest. The largest bonfire is called Ukon-kokko to honor the god Ukko in the hope of receiving bountiful harvests.
translation: 你的封臣们已经到了，节日的具体日期是由我们决定的.夏天的时候黑夜很短，但夜幕降临的时候，你点燃的篝火照亮了整个森林。篝火中最大的被称作乌戈之火，这是为了乌戈神的荣耀，并祈求来年能有丰富的收成。

original: At last, the time of the Ukon juhla festival is upon us. The night comes late during the summer months, but when darkness begins to set in your liege's servants light the bonfires that have been prepared. The largest bonfire is called Ukon-kokko to honor the god Ukko in the hope of receiving bountiful harvests.
translation: 乌戈节终于快要到了。夏天的时候黑夜很短，但夜幕降临的时候，你的领主点燃的篝火照亮了整个森林。篝火中最大的被称作乌戈之火，这是为了乌戈神的荣耀，并祈求来年能有丰富的收成。

original: With the bonfires still lighting up the woods outside in the warm summer night, you and your vassals gather for the great feast your servants have prepared!
translation: 在温暖的夏天夜里，篝火照亮着外面的树木，你把你的封臣们聚集起来，准备享受你的仆人们准备的大餐。

original: With the bonfires still lighting up the woods outside in the warm summer night, you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has prepared!
translation: 在温暖的夏天夜里，篝火照亮着外面的树木，领主把你和[From.GetHerHis]封臣们聚集起来，准备享受[From.GetSheHe]准备的大餐。

original: The bonfires have finished burning for this summer, and the feast has come to an end. Your vassals are returning home, but most seem to agree that the Ukon juhla festival was well worth the trip.
translation: 篝火已经烧完了，宴会也就要结束了。你的封臣们一一准备回家，他们中的绝大多数都觉得这次乌戈节宴会真是不虚此行。

original: The bonfires have finished burning for this summer, and the feast has come to an end. You and the other vassals are returning home, but you all agree that the Ukon juhla festival was well worth the trip.
translation: 篝火已经烧完了，宴会也就要结束了。你和其他封臣们开始准备回家，你们都觉得来参加这次乌戈节真是不虚此行。

original: The Užgavenes festival takes place in spring to celebrate the end of winter and the coming of summer.
translation: 乌日加维内斯节一般在春季，这是为了庆祝冬天的结束和夏天的开始。

original: You begin preparations for the Užgavenes festival.\n
translation: 你开始为乌日加维内斯节做准备。\n

original: Invitations have gone out to your vassals asking them to join you in this spring's Užgavenes festival. You have decided to make the festival this year a special one, remembered by both spirits and men for many years to come.
translation: 我们已经向封臣们发出了参加今年春天乌日加维内斯节的邀请函。你希望让神灵和参加的宾客们都能在很多年内记住这次节日，这个宴会。

original: Invitation to the Užgavenes festival is sent.
translation: 乌日加维内斯节的请柬已经发出去了。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] for this spring's Užgavenes festival. There you will celebrate the coming of summer and the defeat of Lašininis, the winter spirit, at the hands of Kanapinis, the spirit of spring.
translation: 你的领主[From.GetTitledFirstName]邀请你参加今年春天参加[From.GetHerHim]主持的乌日加维内斯节。你庆祝夏天的来临，冬之神拉西尼尼斯被打败，我们迎来了春天之神卡纳皮尼斯。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend the Užgavenes festival! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in Lašininis, Kanapinis and the other spirits, and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]拒绝了参加乌日加维内斯节的提议！很明显，[From.GetSheHe]根本就不相信春之神，冬之神以及其他的神灵，反而遵循与我们道路不相适应的某些其他宗教的奇怪仪式。

original: Your vassals have arrived and the time of the Užgavenes festival is upon us. A large effigy representing winter is burnt, and a symbolic fight is staged between Lašininis, the winter spirit, and Kanapinis, the spirit personifying spring. To everyone's delight, Kanapinis emerges victorious – as always.
translation: 你的封臣们已经到了，乌日加维内斯节的具体时间现在取决于我们。我们烧掉了一个代表冬之神的雕像，在舞台上演了春之神卡纳皮尼斯和冬之神拉西尼尼斯之间的决斗。让观众们高兴的是，卡纳皮尼斯每次都能获得最终的胜利。

original: At last, the time of the Užgavenes festival is upon us. A large effigy representing winter is burnt, and a symbolic fight is staged between Lašininis, the winter spirit, and Kanapinis, the spirit personifying spring. To everyone's delight, Kanapinis emerges victorious – as always.
translation: 乌日加维内斯节终于到了。随着代表冬季的巨大人像被烧毁，人们表演着冬之精灵拉西尼尼斯与春之精灵卡纳皮尼斯之间的战斗。人们为卡纳皮尼斯那不出意料的胜利而欢呼。

original: As the winter effigy continues to burn outside, hastening the coming of summer, you and your vassals gather for the great feast your servants have prepared!
translation: 冬之雕像继续熊熊燃烧，夏天的脚步越来越快，你和你的封臣们开始准备参加晚宴了！

original: As the winter effigy continues to burn outside, hastening the coming of summer, you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has prepared!
translation: 冬之雕像继续熊熊燃烧，夏天的脚步越来越快，你和你的领主和 [From.GetHerHis]其他的封臣们已经要准备享受[From.GetSheHe]准备的晚宴了！

original: The effigy has finished burning, the spirit of Lašininis has been defeated, and the feast has come to an end. Your vassals are returning home, but most seem to agree that the Užgavenes festival was well worth the trip.
translation: 雕像已经烧完了，拉西尼尼斯神已经被打败了，宴会也结束了。你的封臣们一个个回家了，他们中的绝大多数都觉得这次节日真是不虚此行。

original: The effigy has finished burning, the spirit of Lašininis has been defeated, and the feast has come to an end. You and the other vassals are returning home, but you all agree that the Užgavenes festival was well worth the trip.
translation: 雕像已经烧完了，拉西尼尼斯神已经被打败了，宴会也结束了。你和其他的封臣们都回去了，你们都觉得这次节日真是不虚此行。

original: Refused to Give Offering for Blot

translation: 拒绝参加乌日加维内斯节

original: Our brethren in Norway and Denmark are adopting foreign customs and speak with ever thicker accents. Perhaps it is time to develop our own distinct culture...
translation: 我们的挪威和丹麦兄弟开始接受越来越多的外来习俗，口音也是越来越重了。也许我们也该发展些我们自己的文化了。

original: Our brethren in Sweden and Denmark are adopting foreign customs and speak with ever thicker accents. Perhaps it is time to develop our own distinct culture...
translation: 我们的瑞典和丹麦兄弟开始接受越来越多的外来习俗，口音也是越来越重了。也许我们也该发展些我们自己的文化了。

original: Our brethren in Norway and Sweden are adopting foreign customs and speak with ever thicker accents. Perhaps it is time to develop our own distinct culture...
translation: 我们的挪威和瑞典兄弟开始接受越来越多的外来习俗，口音也是越来越重了。也许我们也该发展些我们自己的文化了。

original: The ancestral tongue is spoken by ever fewer of our people, yet the old ways are not forgotten. We are something new - they call us 'Normans'.
translation: 会说我们祖先的语言的人越来越少，但是我们并没有忘记过去的习俗。他们给了我们一个新的名字——诺曼人。

original: The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Swedish.
translation: [Root.GetName]的人们发展了他们自己的语言和习俗，现在他们已经可以看成维京人分化出来的一个新的族群了。他们自称瑞典人。

original: What will they think of next, I wonder.
translation: 我很想知道他们接下来会怎么改变。

original: Welcome into the fold, my Swedish brothers and sisters.
translation: 来自瑞典的兄弟姐妹们，欢迎你们。

original: The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Norwegian.
translation: [Root.GetName]的人们发展了他们自己的语言和习俗，现在他们已经可以看成维京人分化出来的一个新的族群了，他们自称挪威人。

original: What will they think of next, I wonder.
translation: 我很想知道他们接下来会怎么改变

original: Welcome into the fold, my Norwegian brothers and sisters.
translation: 来自挪威的兄弟姐妹们，欢迎你们。

original: The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Danish.
translation: [Root.GetName]的人们发展了他们自己的语言和习俗，现在他们已经可以看成维京人分化出来的一个新的族群了，他们自称丹麦人。

original: What will they think of next, I wonder.
translation: 我很想知道他们接下来会怎么改变

original: Welcome into the fold, my Danish brothers and sisters.
translation: 来自丹麦的兄弟姐妹们，欢迎你们。

original: The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Norman.
translation: [Root.GetName]的人们发展了他们自己的语言和习俗，现在他们已经可以看成维京人分化出来的一个新的族群了，他们自称诺曼人。

original: What will they think of next, I wonder.
translation: 我很想知道他们接下来会怎么改变

original: Welcome into the fold, my Norman brothers and sisters.
translation: 诺曼兄弟姐妹们，欢迎你们。

original: This character works himself into a mad frenzy during battle, charging fearlessly at the enemy.
translation: 这个角色会在战斗中进入完全的癫狂状态，向敌人发起无畏的冲锋。

original: As the enemy draws near during the battle, an uncontrollable rage begins to swell within you. You furiously bite down on the edges of your shield in an attempt to devour it. Trembling with anger, you then raise your great axe and charge howling into the enemy ranks. Many of the cowards attempt to flee at the mere sight of you, but your axe has no mercy to spare for them.
translation: 战场上，敌人越来越近了，于是无法控制的愤怒吞噬了你，你一口咬在盾牌上，几乎想要吞噬它。接着，愤怒的你举起了大斧向敌人的阵列砍去。懦夫们一看到你就开始逃跑，但是你手中的大斧早就饥渴难耐了。

original: Consumed by bloodlust and shaking with berserker rage, you cleave the skull of yet another foe with your axe. That was a worthy opponent, and only when you turn to seek more fodder for your axe do you notice the large spear impaling your thigh.
translation: 被嗜血欲望和狂战士之怒吞噬的你用斧头劈开了又一个敌人的头骨。那是个配得上你的敌人，正当你转身去为你的斧头寻找更多敌人时，你才注意到一只长矛刺穿了你的大腿。
就是个新的伤口而已么……

original: Consumed by bloodlust and shaking with berserker rage, you cleave the skull of yet another foe with your axe. That was a worthy opponent, and only when you turn to seek more fodder for your axe do you notice the long arrow impaling your thigh.
translation: 杀戮欲和狂战士之怒吞噬了你，你的战斧劈开了又一个敌人的头骨。这曾是一名相称的劲敌，而你正要转身去寻找更多战斧的饲料时，你才发现刺穿你大腿的那根长箭。

original: Your berserker rage has left you isolated and surrounded, and as you swing your axe at the nearest foe, an arrow burrows into your shoulder and two more dig into your chest. Throwing your shield aside, you wield your axe two-handed and cleave yet another skull before falling to your knees. Moments later a dozen enemies hurl themselves at you like a pack of rabid dogs.
translation: 狂战士之怒使你脱离了部队，被敌人包围。当你的大斧砍向最近的敌人之时，一只箭射进了你的肩膀，而又有两只命中了你的胸膛。你扔开盾牌，双持斧头劈开了又一个的头颅，这才跪倒在地。接着，一队敌人像疯狗一样冲向你。

original: It is a good day to die...

Your vision turns red with bloodlust and you charge ahead without regard for your safety. As your nearest companions hurry to keep up, you surrender to your berserker rage and your axe cuts a wide swath in the enemy ranks. When the dust settles, they find you standing over half a dozen slain foes.
translation: 你眼前的景象被嗜血欲望变成了红色，不顾自己的安危向前冲锋。离你最近的伙伴努力跟上你，但你完全被狂战士之怒控制，用大斧在敌人的阵列中砍出一条宽阔的道路。尘埃落定后，他们发现你站在半打被杀敌人的尸体上。

original: Despite your best efforts, you have thus far been cheated of a glorious death in battle. Sadly, you no longer have the endurance or constitution necessary to sustain your berserker rage. Perhaps such things are best left for the youth...
translation: 尽管你尽了最大的努力，你直到如今还是侥幸逃脱了战场上光荣的死亡。可惜你不再有足够的毅力和体格来支撑你的狂战士之怒了。或许这些东西最好还是留给年轻人去做吧……

original: You are in the middle of a heated discussion with [From.GetTitledFirstName], your bothersome courtier, when you feel the berserker rage rising within you. As [From.GetFirstName] continues to babble about trivial concerns, you bite down hard on the wooden table and begin to froth at the mouth. Soon your vision turns red as the familiar bloodlust is roused from its slumber...
translation: 你在和你烦人的的廷臣[From.GetTitledFirstName]讨论时，感觉体内迸发出狂战士之怒。[From.GetFirstName]不停地谈论一些琐碎的问题，然后你一下咬住了木质的桌子，开始口吐白沫。很快，你视野变成红色，熟悉的嗜血欲望从沉睡中苏醒……

original: As your servants hurry towards your throne room to see what the commotion is about, the doors fly open and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] tumbles out with torn clothes, several missing teeth and a face covered in bruises. He runs away in mad panic as you struggle to calm down.
translation: 你的仆人听到骚乱后匆匆忙忙赶到你的房间，门猛地打开了，[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]跌跌撞撞衣衫不整地爬出来，脸上有几处淤青并且少了几颗牙。他在疯狂的恐惧中逃走了，而你尽力让自己平静下来。

original: I probably shouldn't have done that...

You bite off a large chunk of table and spit it out as [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] continues to drone on. The berserker rage is upon you, but with great effort you manage to channel it towards the table instead of [FromFrom.GetFirstName]. With your axe you reduce the table to firewood, and as you lie panting in the wreckage, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] finally stops his tirade to ask: Are you feeling well, my [Root.GetTitle]?
translation: 你把桌子咬掉了一大块，然后吐了出来，[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]仍然在絮絮叨叨。狂战士之怒似乎控制了你，你尽了最大努力把怒火集中在桌子上而不是[FromFrom.GetFirstName]。你用斧头把桌子劈成了柴火，气喘吁吁地躺在废墟中。[FromFrom.GetFirstName]终于停止了他的长篇大论问道：「你还好吗，我的[Root.GetTitle]？」

original: This character is a veteran of the Varangian Guard.
translation: 这个人是个瓦兰吉卫队老兵。

original: Yes... yes. I just need a moment to collect my wits.
translation: 是…是的。我需要一点点时间总结我的思路。

original: Recruit Varangian warriors from the north into an elite unit that will serve as the personal guard of the [Root.GetTitle].
translation: 招募北方的瓦兰吉战士来组织一只精英部队，作为[Root.GetTitle]的私人卫队。

original: Varangian raiders sailing from the distant north down the rivers leading into the Black Sea have proven themselves to be formidable warriors. You have managed to recruit a great many of their number into a personal guard loyal only to the [Root.GetTitle].\n\nThis new Varangian Guard will not only form a powerful shock force against the Empire's many enemies, but their foreign roots should also preclude them from becoming too entangled in the palace intrigue and power struggles that are so commonplace in [Root.Capital.GetName].
translation: 从遥远北方顺流而下航行到黑海的瓦兰吉劫掠者已被公认为可怕的战士。你成功雇佣了很多瓦兰吉人作为你的卫兵，他们只对[Root.GetTitle]效忠。\n\n这支新组建的瓦兰吉卫队不仅将成为一支威慑帝国敌人们的强大力量，而且他们的外国出身使他们不会同[Root.Capital.GetName]常见的宫廷阴谋和权力斗争牵涉太深。
他们会成为很好的仆人。

original: May they find the excitement they yearn.
translation: 愿他们能够得到渴求的刺激。

original: [From.GetFirstName], what have they done to you?!
I knew those Greeks would be a bad influence.
translation: 我就知道这些希腊人不是什么好东西。

original: It is as I remember it.
translation: 这和我的记忆并无二样。

original: Celebrate the fertility god Jarilo, son of Perun, and the coming of spring with a great festival.
translation: 庆祝丰收之神亚里洛，雷电神佩伦之子，以及春天的到来。

original: You begin preparations for the Jarilo festival.\n
translation: 你开始为亚里洛节做准备。\n

original: Invitations have gone out to your vassals asking them to join you in celebration of Jarilo. You have decided to make the festival this year a special one, remembered by both gods and men for many years to come.
translation: 邀请你的封臣们参加亚里洛节的庆典的请柬已经送出。你已经决定要让今年的这个节日成为独一无二的，让诸神和参加的人回味多年。

original: Invitation to the Jarilo festival is sent.
translation: 送出邀请参加亚里洛节的请柬。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] in celebration of the fertility god Jarilo. There will be a great festival to herald in the coming of spring.
translation: 你的领主[From.GetTitledFirstName]已经邀请你同[From.GetHerHim]一起参加丰收之神亚里洛的庆典。这会是一场宏大的庆典来预示春天的到来。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend the festival! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in Jarilo, Perun or the other gods, and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]拒绝了你的节日邀请！显然[From.GetSheHe]不信仰亚里洛，佩伦或者其他诸神，而是信奉一些其他陌生宗教的奇怪仪式。

original: Your vassals have arrived and the time has come to begin your celebration of Jarilo and the coming of spring. As per tradition, one of them will be chosen to be paraded around as a representation of Jarilo himself. Who shall it be?
translation: 你的封臣们都已经到了，现在是时候开始你的亚里洛庆典了。作为每年的传统，他们中某个人会被选为亚里洛神的替身游行。应该选谁呢？

original: At last the time has come to begin the celebration of Jarilo and the coming of spring. As per tradition, one of you will be chosen to represent Jarilo himself and paraded around. Who shall it be?
translation: 庆祝春天到来的亚里洛节终于开始了。作为每年的传统，你们中的一个会被选为亚里洛神的替身并四处游行。应该选谁呢？

original: As the celebration winds down outside, you and your vassals gather for the great feast you have ordered your servants to prepare!
translation: 随着外面的庆典渐近尾声，你和你的封臣们一起开始享用你的仆人准备的盛宴！

original: As the celebration winds down outside, you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has ordered [From.GetHerHis] servants to prepare!
translation: 随着外面的庆典渐近尾声，你和你的领主以及[From.GetHerHis]其他封臣一起开始享用[From.GetSheHe]已经让[From.GetHerHis]仆人们准备好的盛宴！

original: You have finished your worship of Jarilo for this season, and your vassals are returning home. Most seem to agree that the Jarilo festival was well worth the trip.
translation: 这个季节你对亚里洛神的祭拜已经结束了，你的封臣们正在回家的路上。他们中的大部分人都认为这次赶来参加亚里洛庆典十分值得。

original: You have finished your worship of Jarilo for this season, and the feast has come to an end. You and the other vassals are returning home, but you all agree that the Jarilo festival was well worth the trip.
translation: 这个季节你对亚里洛神的祭拜已经结束了，宴会也接近尾声。你和其他的封臣正在回家的路上，但是你们全都认为这次赶来参加亚里洛庆典十分值得。

original: After much deliberation, you have been chosen to present Jarilo this year! You are glamourously clad and small bells are fastened all over your clothes. Wielding a mallet representing a thunderbolt, you parade around singing and dancing while a noisy crowd follows closely behind you.
translation: 经过深思熟虑，你被选为亚里洛神的替身！你被披上了迷人的外罩，上面系着小铃铛，手中挥动着一把木锤象征着雷电，你四处游行，又唱又跳，身后跟着吵闹的人群。

original: All hail Jarilo, son of Perun!

It has been decided that [From.GetTitledFirstName] is to represent Jarilo this year! He has been clad in a most glamorous way and small bells have been fastened to his clothes. Wielding a mallet representing a thunderbolt, [From.GetFirstName] parades around singing and dancing while a noisy crowd follows closely behind.
translation: 今年[From.GetTitledFirstName]被选为亚里洛神的替身！他被披上了迷人的外罩，上面系着小铃铛，手中挥动着一把木锤象征着雷电，[From.GetFirstName]四处游行，又唱又跳，身后跟着吵闹的人群。

original: All hail Jarilo, son of Perun!

As no proper vassal is available, it falls to you to represent Jarilo this year. You are glamourously clad and small bells are fastened all over your clothes. Wielding a mallet representing a thunderbolt, you parade around singing and dancing while a noisy crowd follows closely behind you.
translation: 因为没有合适的封臣，今年有你自己来做亚里洛神的替身。你被披上了迷人的外罩，上面系着小铃铛。手中挥动着一把木锤象征着雷电，你四处游行，又唱又跳，身后跟着吵闹的人群。

original: A woman claiming to be a völva, a seeress, has been brought before you and she asks to join your court. If her sejdr sorcery is as strong as she claims and she can truly glimpse into the future, her services could prove invaluable...
translation: 一个声称自己是渥尔娃女巫的女人被带到你面前，她请求加入你的宫廷.如果她的巫术像她声称的那样厉害而且她确实能预测未来，她的价值是不可估量的……
不要，把这个女巫打发走。

original: There are rumors of a young woman from an isolated farm in [Root.Capital.GetName] who has been gifted with the mysterious powers of sejdr. The sorcery she wields grants her the power to see into the future and to curse or bless those she lays her eyes on. Will you ask her to join your court?
translation: 有传言说在[Root.Capital.GetName]的一座偏远的农场有一个年轻女人拥有神秘的巫术的力量。她使用的巫术能够预测未来以及诅咒或祝福她用眼睛注视的人的能力。你会要求她加入你的宫廷么？

original: No, I will have nothing to do with her foul witchcraft.
translation: 不，我不想和她愚蠢的妖术有任何关系。

original: A faint whisper draws your attention and you find a haggard old crone in a dark corner of your longhouse. Before you have a chance to throw her out, she explains that she is a völva – a seeress. She claims to be powerful in the ways of sejdr, and she has come to offer you her services.
translation: 一阵轻微的说话声吸引了你的注意力，你在你的长屋的一个阴暗角落里找到了一个憔悴的老太婆.在你把她扔出去之前，她说她是一个渥尔娃女巫。她声称她会强力的巫术，她是来向你贡献她微薄的力量的。

original: So be it. You may stay.
translation: 那就这样吧，你可以留下。

original: You are spending some time with [FromFrom.GetFirstName], who is carrying your unborn child, when [From.GetFirstName], your völva seeress, bursts screaming into your bedchamber. The child is a demon, she wails. I have seen it! You are about to unleash a great evil upon the world!
translation: 你正在和[FromFrom.GetFirstName]闲聊，她怀着你未出生的孩子，这时你的渥尔娃女巫[From.GetFirstName]突然尖叫着闯入你的卧室。她悲声号叫着，这个孩子是个恶魔，我已经预见到了！你将把一个高等恶魔带到这个世界上！

original: Could... could it be so? Is the child cursed?
translation: 真……真是这样么？这个孩子被诅咒了么？

original: It is the dead of night when a sudden chill comes upon you. You open your eyes and sit up only to see [From.GetFirstName] standing at the foot of your bed staring at you in complete silence. After rubbing the sleep out of your eyes, you look again and now there is no sign of the child.
translation: 夜深人静的时候你突然感到一股恶寒。你睁开眼坐起来，只看见[From.GetFirstName]站在你的床前静静地盯着你。在睡意消退之后，你环顾四周，这个孩子又消失不见了。

original: [From.GetFirstName] is sitting on the floor, playing with [From.GetHerHis] toys when something dark suddenly seems to come over the child. While spasming wildly, [From.GetFirstName] cries out in a tongue foreign to you and [From.GetHerHis] eyes roll back inside [From.GetHerHis] head.
translation: [From.GetFirstName]正坐在地板上玩着[From.GetHerHis]玩具，突然这个孩子被一阵阴影覆盖。在剧烈的抽搐之后，[From.GetFirstName]用一种陌生的腔调哭了出来，而且[From.GetHerHis]眼睛后转看进[From.GetHerHis]脑袋

original: That can't be a good sign...

An inhuman wail interrupts your sleep, and you hurry outside with your axe. On the ground in front of the longhouse you find [From.GetFirstName] running around in circles upside down on all fours like a spider.
translation: 一阵非人类的哭声把你从睡梦中惊醒，你急匆匆的拿着你的斧头走了出去。在长屋前面的地上你发现[From.GetFirstName]正在面朝天，四肢着地地转圈，像只蜘蛛一样。
[From.GetFirstName]的行为有时会引起你的担忧。

original: You send the wretched creature away.
translation: 你把这个可恶的家伙赶走了。

original: Your men haul the woman outside and throw her into a nearby pile of refuse.
translation: 你的人把这个女人拖了出去并把她扔进了附近的一堆垃圾中。

original: You issue clear instructions not to permit the witch within a stone's throw of your longhouse.
translation: 你发出明确的指令，不要让任何女巫靠近你的长屋一投石的距离内。

original: A völva is regarded as a powerful seeress that practises sejdr, a form of sorcery. Among other things, she deals with curses, premonitions and omens of things to come.
translation: 渥尔娃女巫被认为是强大的会使用巫术的女预言家。她还会诅咒和预测未来。

original: \n§RAll special event troops will be disbanded!§!
translation: \n§R所有的特别事件部队都会被解散！§!

original: \nNo special event troops will be disbanded.

[From.GetTitledName] ambushes you as you leave your longhouse and speaks to you in a pleading voice. [FromFrom.GetFirstName] must be purged of the evil [FromFrom.GetSheHe] carries within [FromFrom.GetHerHim]. There is no other way. I can perform a galdr ritual, but I won't lie - the child may or may not survive the ordeal. Nevertheless, the demon must be vanquished.
translation: [From.GetTitledName]在你离开你的长屋的时候截住了你，并用恳求的语气对你说。必须净化[FromFrom.GetFirstName]体内在[FromFrom.GetSheHe]降生时与[FromFrom.GetHerHim]一同到来的邪恶。除此之外没有别的办法。我可以施展一种咒术仪式，但我不会骗你——这个孩子也许有可能经受不住严酷的考验。但是，恶魔必须被击败。

original: If you so much as touch [FromFrom.GetFirstName]...

The galdr ritual to cleanse your spawn of evil has begun. The child is brought to a raised platform in a grove where [FromFrom.GetFirstName] awaits surrounded by chanting maidens. You are not permitted to witness the sacred ritual itself, so you depart the grove and wait.
translation: 净化你那魔鬼上身的孩子的咒术仪式开始了。[FromFrom.GetFirstName]在一片树丛中的升起的平台上面等候，身边围着吟唱的少女们，孩子被送到了施术者那里。你被禁止观看这一神圣的仪式，所以你离开这片树林，慢慢等待。

original: The incantations from the grove suddenly stop, and several maidens, their white gowns red with someone else's blood, run past screaming. Fearing the worst you hurry back, but when you reach the platform you find only the butchered remains of [From.GetFirstName]... and [FromFrom.GetFirstName] standing smiling next to them.
translation: 树林中的吟唱声突然停止了，几名少女尖叫着跑了出来，身上的白色长袍带着其他人的血。你害怕最坏的情况发生，急忙赶了回去，但是当你抵达平台的时候你只看见[From.GetFirstName]的残骸……以及[FromFrom.GetFirstName]微笑着站在它们旁边。

original: A solemn procession of maidens led by [From.GetTitledName] finally emerges from the grove, but there is no sign of [FromFrom.GetFirstName]. It is done, [From.GetFirstName] announces. The demon is no more... but I fear there was no way to save your child. The corruption simply went too deep.
translation: 在[From.GetTitledName]带领下的一队庄严的少女终于从树林中走了出来，但是没有看见[FromFrom.GetFirstName]。仪式完成了，[From.GetFirstName]说：「魔鬼已经被消灭了……但是我很遗憾没能保住你的孩子，因为堕落的程度太严重了。」

original: Then your life is forfeit as well, witch!
translation: 那么你也丢掉了你的性命，女巫！

original: Leave while you still can, [From.GetFirstName], and never return.
translation: 趁我没有反悔赶紧离开吧，[From.GetFirstName]，千万别再让我看见你。

original: You have my thanks... it had to be done.
translation: 请接受我的谢意……这是不得不做的事情。

original: The chanting from the grove comes closer and [From.GetTitledName] appears together with [FromFrom.GetFirstName], flanked on either side by singing maidens. The child looks shaken, but otherwise unharmed. It is done, [From.GetFirstName] announces. The demon is no more. [FromFrom.GetFirstName] is [FromFrom.GetHerselfHimself] again.
translation: 树林中的吟唱声渐渐靠近，[From.GetTitledName]和[FromFrom.GetFirstName]一起出现，两边排着唱着歌的少女们。孩子看上去很虚弱，但是并没有受伤.仪式完成了，[From.GetFirstName]说.魔鬼已经被消灭了。[FromFrom.GetFirstName]又变回[FromFrom.GetHerselfHimself]了。

original: The chanting from the grove comes closer and [From.GetTitledName] appears together with [FromFrom.GetFirstName], flanked on either side by singing maidens. The child's vacant stare hints that something is wrong. It is done, [From.GetFirstName] announces. The demon is no more, but the struggle was great. I fear it has left scars on [FromFrom.GetFirstName] that may never heal...
translation: 树林中的吟唱声渐渐靠近，[From.GetTitledName]和[FromFrom.GetFirstName]一起出现，两边排列着唱着歌的少女们。孩子空洞的眼神表明事情有些不妙。仪式完成了，[From.GetFirstName]说，魔鬼已经被消灭了，但是它的抵抗非常顽强。我很遗憾在[FromFrom.GetFirstName]的身上留下了无法治愈的伤痕……

original: The corpse of [From.GetTitledName] was discovered today at the bottom of a steep ravine with a broken neck. It seems to have been a tragic accident ordained by the gods, but strangely, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] was seen standing next to the ravine, peering down into it just before the tragedy was revealed.
translation: 今天在一个陡峭的山谷底部发现了[From.GetTitledName]的颈骨折断的尸体。这看上去像是由诸神导演的一场悲惨的事故，但是奇怪的是，有人看见[FromFrom.GetFirstName]在悲剧发生之前站在山谷边上向下凝视。

original: [From.GetTitledName] was found impaled on a wooden fence just outside your longhouse this morning. You can only deduce that [From.GetSheHe] fell on the fence from the roof of your longhouse, though what business [From.GetSheHe] had up there you cannot fathom. Poor [FromFrom.GetFirstName] was the first one to lay eyes on the gruesome scene...
translation: 今天早上[From.GetTitledName]被人发现钉死在你长屋外面的木篱笆上。你只能由此推断[From.GetSheHe]从你的长屋上面跌落摔到了篱笆上，虽然很难推测[From.GetSheHe]在那上面干了什么。可怜的[FromFrom.GetFirstName]是第一个目睹这一可怕场景的人……

original: [From.GetTitledName] was found stuffed head first into a barrel full of rain water this morning, with only [From.GetHerHis] pale, rigid legs visible above the surface. Your guards speculate that [From.GetSheHe] tripped, somehow fell into the barrel and then tragically drowned. [FromFrom.GetFirstName] was found playing just nearby, but doesn't seem to have seen anything.
translation: 今天早上[From.GetTitledName]被发现头朝下的栽在盛满雨水的水桶里，只有[From.GetHerHis]苍白僵硬的双腿露在外面。你的卫兵推测[From.GetSheHe]绊倒了，并且不知道为什么栽进水桶里悲剧地淹死了。[FromFrom.GetFirstName]就在旁边玩耍，但是好像并没有看见事情是怎么发生的。

original: Yes... I suppose it could have happened that way...
translation: 好吧…… 我就认为事情可能是这么发生的吧……

original: After uniting the warring steppe tribes under a single banner for the first time, the great warlord Temujin, or Genghis Khan as he now styles himself, has set out to expand his growing empire further. In Central Asia, Mongolian envoys to Ala ed-Din of Khwarezm have been massacred and this is an insult the Great Khan cannot ignore. He has led his armies west and now stands poised to punish the powerful Muslim realm for its insolence. Like a coiled spring, the massed Mongol armies are ready to be unleashed upon the world. Where will they stop?
translation: 纷争不休的草原诸部首次统合在同一旗帜下，伟大的首领铁木真，或者像他自己现在自称的那样叫做成吉思汗，开始扩张他的帝国。在中亚，蒙古人派去面见花剌子模的阿拉乌丁的使节被杀掉了，这是可汗无法忍受的侮辱。他已经率领他的军队向西进军并准备惩罚强大的穆斯林王国的傲慢。就像蓄势待发的弓箭一样，集合起来的蒙古军队已经准备好让世界颤抖了。哪里会是他们征途的终点呢？

original: The burghers of the Imperial Free Cities of Lübeck and Hamburg in Northern Germany have just formed a trade alliance that will eventually become known as the Hanseatic League. Meanwhile, the terrible Mongol Horde has swept like a scythe through Eastern Europe, effortlessly mowing down all opposition. As even the Holy Roman Emperor Friedrich II cowers in fear, the great invasion suddenly comes to an inexplicable halt as both Batu Khan of the Golden Horde and Hulagu Khan of the Ilkhanate return to Karakorum to elect a new Great Khan.
translation: 德意志北部的帝国自由市吕贝克和汉堡的市民刚刚组成了一个贸易联盟，这就是之后著名的汉萨同盟。同时，可怕的蒙古部落像一把镰刀一样扫过东欧，不费吹灰之力扫除了所有的抵抗。就连神圣罗马帝国皇帝弗里德里希二世都由于害怕而退缩之时，这场大入侵突然莫名其妙的结束了，因为金帐汗国的拔都汗和伊尔汗国的旭烈兀汗都返回哈剌和林去选出一位新的大汗。

original: Catholicism is one of the oldest branches of Christianity and the one that has had the biggest impact on the history of Europe. The formal head of the religion is the Bishop of Rome - the Pope.
translation: 天主教是基督教最古老的分支之一，其对欧洲历史的影响最大。该宗教的正式首领是罗马主教——教宗。

original: Originally a reform movement within the Catholic church, Waldensian heretics are anti-clerical and advocate a return to vows of poverty. They are opposed to capital punishment and believe that laymen can also administer the sacraments. This heresy has no formal head and no special game mechanics.
translation: 瓦勒度派异端原本只是天主教会中的一股改革浪潮，他们反对教权，提倡回归安贫的誓言。他们反对死刑，认为普通教徒也能施行圣事。这个异端没有正式的领袖和专门对应的的游戏机制。

original: Lollard heretics are opposed to perceived corruption within the Catholic Church. Like many Catholic heresies, they loathe the wealth and ostentation of the clergy and advocate a return to a more original form of Christianity. This heresy has no formal head and no special game mechanics.
translation: 罗拉德派异端反对天主教会的腐败。和许多天主教异端一样，他们憎恨生活奢华、拥有大量财富的教职人员，希望回归更原始更纯粹的基督教。这个异端没有正式的领袖和专门对应的的游戏机制。

original: The Orthodox Church is the other main branch of Chalcedonian Christianity that up until 1054 was formally united with the Catholic Church, although the political division can be traced back to the crowning of Charlemagne as Roman Emperor by Pope Leo III in 800, which did not sit well with the Emperor in Constantinople. The nominal head of the Orthodox Church is the Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople, but he does not interfere in the affairs of other Patriarchs.
translation: 正教会是另外一个参加迦克墩会议的基督教主要分支，直到公元1054年还在形式上和天主教会合为一体。虽然两者政治上的分歧可以追溯到公元800年查理曼被教宗利奥三世加冕为罗马人的皇帝，这引起了君士坦丁堡的皇帝的不满。正教会的名义首领是君士坦丁堡普世牧首，但是他不干涉其他牧首的事务。

original: Miaphysite Christianity encompasses the Coptic Church and the Armenian Apostolic Church. Miaphysites stress that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Miaphysite Church is the Pope of Alexandria.
translation: 基督合性派包括科普特教会和亚美尼亚使徒教会。合性论强调基督只有一个性质，但又同时具有人性与神性。这种观点使他们在公元451年的迦克敦会议后与主流基督教派分道扬镳。虽然正教会和天主教基督徒没有认为它是完全的异端，但仍有很大分歧。合性论教会名义上的首领是亚历山大教宗。

original: Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position where Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. Closely related to Miaphytism, Monophysites are regarded as a Miaphysite heresy in-game. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.
translation: 基督一性派是早期基督教的一种异端，认为基督只有神性。这与聂斯脱里派的基督同时具有神性和人性的观点相反。与基督合性派密切相关，一性论教会在游戏里被认为是基督合性派的一种异端。一性论教会名义上的首领是亚历山大一性派教宗。

original: Monothelitism is a Christological doctrine that was declared heretical in 681. Monothelites attempted to develop the Miaphysite and Monophysite stance on the single nature of Christ by saying he had both a human and a divine nature but only a single will. The nominal head of the Monothelite Church is the Monothelite Patriarch of Antioch.
translation: 基督一志论是基督论的一种，在681年被宣布为异端。基督一志论教会发展了基督合性论和一性论教会关于基督只有一个性质的观点，认为基督既有人性又有神性，但是只有一种意志。一志论教会的名义首领是安条克一志论牧首。

original: Sunni Islam is by far the most widespread form of the religion. It is the more orthodox of the two main branches of Islam but the origin of the Sunni-Shia schism was largely political in nature. The Sunnis accepted the first Caliph, Abu Bakr, whereas the Shiites rejected him in favor of Ali. Sunni Muslims hold strictly to the Sunnah - the sayings and actions of Muhammad - as collected in the Hadiths, which form the basis for Sunni jurisprudence. The formal head of Sunni Islam is the (Sunni) Caliph.
translation: 伊斯兰逊尼派是该宗教至今为止传播最广的形式。在伊斯兰教两大派系中逊尼派被认为更为坚持正统，但是逊尼什叶分裂的源头本质上大都是政治分歧。逊尼派承认第一个哈里发艾布·伯克尔的合法性，而什叶派拒绝承认他的合法性而认为阿里才是合法的哈里发。逊尼派穆斯林严格遵循圣行——穆罕默德的言行——并集结于圣训之中，圣训还构成了逊尼派立法的基础。伊斯兰逊尼派的正式首领是（逊尼派）哈里发。

original: Zikri Islam is a Sunni heresy in-game. Zikris are the followers of the Imam Akhar Zaman Hazrat Syed Muhammad Jaunpuri (Imam Mehdi.)
translation: 伊斯兰诵经派在游戏中是一个逊尼派的异端。诵经派是阿克哈·扎曼·哈兹拉特·赛义德·穆罕默德·贾普里伊玛目（马赫迪伊玛目）的追随者。

original: Shi'a is the short form of Shi'atul Ali, or the Party of Ali, which rejected the first Caliph Abu Bakr in favor of Ali. Shi'a Islam is the less orthodox of the two main branches of Islam and accepts the idea of intercession by dead Imams on behalf of the living. The formal head of Shi'a Islam is the (Shiite) Caliph.
translation: 什叶派 Shi'a 是 Shi'atul Ali 的缩写，又称为阿里派，他们拒绝承认第一个哈里发阿布·伯克尔而拥护阿里。在伊斯兰两大派系中什叶派较少坚持正统，并且接受死去的伊玛目为生者代祷的理念。伊斯兰什叶派的正式首领是（什叶派）哈里发。

original: Bektashism is a Sufi mystic order whose central tenet is the Wahdat-ul-Wujood - the single unified entity Allah-Muhammed-Ali. In the game it is regarded as a heresy.
translation: 拜克塔什教团是一个苏菲神秘主义教团，中心信条是Wahdat-ul-Wujood——即安拉-穆罕默德-阿里合一。在游戏中它被认为是一种异端。

original: The Druze religion originated in the Ismaili sect of Shi'a Islam, but has many features of gnosticism and neoplatonism in addition to those of the Abrahamic religions.
translation: 德鲁兹派源自伊斯兰什叶派的伊斯玛仪教派，但是在那些亚伯拉罕宗教的基础上又吸收了诺斯替主义和新柏拉图主义的特点。

original: Tengrism is the religion of the steppe peoples of Eurasia, especially Turkish and Mongol nomads. The chief god is Tengri, the creator god who rules the skies. Shamanism and animism also feature prominently in the religion.
translation: 长生天信仰是欧亚大草原上的游牧族群，特别是突厥和蒙古游牧民信奉的宗教。主神是创世天神腾格里大神。这一宗教具有鲜明的萨满教和泛灵教特征。

original: Baltic paganism is polytheistic, with a pantheon of gods led by Dievs, god of the sky. Other main gods include Perkunas, god of thunder and lightning, very similar to the Germanic god Thor and the Slavic Perun. Other important deities include Saule, goddess of the sun and fertility, Daugava and Meness.
translation: 波罗的原始宗教是一种多神信仰，主神是天神季耶瓦斯。其他主神包括雷电之神佩尔库纳斯，和日耳曼人的雷神索尔以及斯拉夫人的雷神佩伦十分类似，其他重要神明包括太阳和繁殖女神绍莱，道加瓦和墨涅斯。

original: Finnic paganism is diverse, varying a lot between tribes and regions. It is shamanistic and animist, revering a multitude of gods, including Ukko/Perkele, Kuu and, in the east, Mastor-Ava, goddess of the Earth.
translation: 芬兰原始宗教多种多样，不同部落和地区变化很大。它具有萨满教和泛灵论的特征，崇拜很多神灵，包括乌戈/佩尔凯莱、库乌、以及东部信仰的大地女神马斯托尔-阿瓦。

original: The Aztec religion features a creation myth centered on sacrifice - even gods were sacrificed to keep the sun moving. This is reflected in the many festivals and rituals of the religion, which feature human sacrifice on a massive scale. The chief gods are Huitzilopochtli, god of war and human sacrifice, Tlaloc, god of thunder and rain, Xiuhtecuhtli, god of fire, Xipe Totec, 'our Lord the Flayed One' and Quetzalcoatl, god of wisdom.
translation: 阿兹特克信仰的创世神话里充满着献祭——为了让太阳保持运转甚至诸神也要被献祭。这反映在许多该宗教的节日和仪式里的大规模人祭上。主神包括战神人祭之神维齐洛波奇特利，雷雨神特拉洛克，火神修提库特里，剥皮之主西佩托堤克，以及智慧之神羽蛇神魁札尔科亚特尔。

original: Slavic heathenry is polytheistic, the chief god being Perun, god of thunder and lightning, quite similar to the Germanic god Thor. Other important deities include Veles, god of the underworld, Svarog, Jarilo and Svantevit. In addition, many tribes revere local gods.
translation: 斯拉夫异教信仰是一种多神信仰，主神是雷电之神佩伦，类似日耳曼人的雷神索尔。其他重要的神灵包括大地、水和冥界之神韦列斯，火神斯瓦罗格，繁衍植物生长战争与丰收之神亚里洛以及斯维托维德。此外许多部落崇拜当地的神灵。

original: The African religion includes many of the diverse pagan beliefs of the tribes of Sub-Saharan Africa. Ancestor worship, animism and totemistic shamanism dominate, but there also various pantheons of gods.
translation: 非洲泛灵教是对撒哈拉沙漠以南的非洲部落各种原始宗教的泛称。以祖先崇拜、泛灵论、图腾崇拜以及萨满教为主，除此还有很多很多的神。

original: Zoroastrians worship Ahura Mazda, the uncreated God, as proclaimed by the ancient Iranian prophet Zoroaster. It was the official religion of all Persian empires (except the Hellenic Seleucid Empire) until the Muslim conquest of the Sassanid Empire in 651. The ancient form of the religion involved great sacred hill top fires, the exposure of dead bodies to scavenger birds for cleansing, and religious close-kin marriages in imitation of Ahura Mazda and Zoroaster.
translation: 祆教崇拜阿胡拉·马兹达，不受造之神，由古伊朗先知琐罗亚斯德启示。直到公元651年穆斯林征服萨珊王朝为止，它是所有波斯帝国的国教（除了希腊化的塞琉古帝国）。古老的宗教礼仪包括圣山顶上的圣火、天葬以及效仿阿胡拉·马兹达和琐罗亚斯德的近亲结婚。

original: Mazdak was a Zoroastrian priest who claimed to be a prophet of Ahura Mazda. He attempted to reform the religion with Gnostic elements, and advocated communal possessions and welfare programs. His teachings fell out of favor with the Shahanshah Kavadh I in 524, but pockets of there heresy survived in remote areas. This heresy has no formal head and no special game mechanics.
translation: 马兹达克是祆教的祭司，他声称自己是阿胡拉·马兹达的先知。他尝试以诺斯替元素进行宗教改革，并主张财产公有制和福利项目。公元524年他的教义失去了萨珊皇帝卡瓦特一世的垂青，但在偏远地区仍然有异端隐匿着。这个异端没有正式的首脑也没有特殊的游戏机制。

original: The Cherbi is the leader of the Kheshig, the imperial guard of the Mongol Empire. They are charged with the protection of the empire's most important nobility, and the position as their commander is a very prestigious one.
translation: 阇里必是怯薛的首领，大蒙古国的皇家卫士。他们负责保卫重要的贵族们，他们的指挥官地位很高。

original: Darkhan is a prestigious Mongolian title bestowed by the Khan upon those who have served him exceptionally well. Genghis Khan awarded this title to those allies who aided him during his rise to power.
translation: 达尔汗是汗王授予的一个威望很高的头衔。成吉思汗把这一头衔赐予了对他崛起贡献卓著的人。

original: This title was originally granted to Mongolian battlefield commanders, but as they were awarded conquered land to administrate, it came to represent a form of higher nobility.
translation: 这一头衔最初授予战场上的蒙古指挥官，在授予那些征服后土地的治理者时，意味着一个很高的贵族头衔。

original: This honorific, which means hero or valiant warrior, is the rough equivalent of European knighthood. It is usually granted only to those who have truly distinguished themselves in battle.
translation: 这个称呼意味着英雄或英勇的战士，大致相当于欧洲的骑士身份。通常只授予那些的确在战斗中战功卓著的人。

original: The Lawspeaker memorizes the law of the realm and serves as its highest judicator. Needless to say, this comes with a great amount of prestige and responsibility.
translation: 法律宣讲官熟记领地的法律并服务于最高法官。当然，这意味着很高的荣誉和责任。

original: The Dróttseti serves as a steward of the realm in a function similar to a seneschal, and it is considered to be a very prestigious post.
translation: 大总管是王国的财政官，类似于管家。这在过去这是很高的荣誉。

original: Skaldic poetry is a greatly respected art, and the Court Skald is regarded as the realm's foremost expert on verse and prose. The Skald is ultimately responsible for chronicling the ruler's deeds for posterity.
translation: 诗歌是一项备受尊重的艺术，宫廷诗人是全国最著名的诗歌散文专家。宫廷诗人将被统治者的后继者记入统治者的事迹中。

original: Literally meaning Marksman, the Merkismaðr has the honor of serving as the standard-bearer.
translation: 字面上的意思就是射手，梅奇斯莫德享有掌旗的荣誉。

original: The Hirdmen are seen as the ruler's trusted companions in arms, and the holders of this title command a great deal of respect.
translation: 赫德曼被视为统治者在战斗中最信任的人，拥有者享有极大的荣誉。

original: The Shahrwarãz, the Boar of the Empire, is a prestigious honorary title dating back to the Sassanids. In Zoroastrianism, the boar is closely associated with the Izad Vahram, the epitome of victory. This honorific can only be bestowed upon those with exceptional martial ability.
translation: 沙赫尔瓦拉兹，帝国的野猪，这个极高荣誉的头衔可追溯到萨珊帝国时期。在祆教中，野猪是伊扎德·瓦赫拉姆的伙伴，胜利的象征。这个称号只能授予那些拥有特殊军事才干的人。

original: This honorific means black hawk and was granted to several gifted Sassanid generals for their achievements on the field of battle. It can only be bestowed upon those with exceptional martial ability.
translation: 这个头衔的意思是黑隼，被授予了几名战功赫赫萨珊将领。这个称号只能授予那些拥有特殊军事才干的人。

original: This honorific means falcon and was granted to several gifted Sassanid generals for their achievements on the field of battle. It can only be bestowed upon those with exceptional martial ability.
translation: 这个头衔的意思是猎鹰，被授予了几名战功赫赫萨珊将领。这个称号只能授予那些拥有特殊军事才干的人。

original: The Pushtigban-salar is the appointed commander of the royal guard, and as such, commands a significant amount of respect.
translation: 禁军指挥使是皇家卫兵的指挥者，因此，这是个很大的荣誉。

original: This title, roughly meaning army chief, can be traced all the way back to the Achaemenid Empire, and during the Sassanid reign there were four Spahbods assigned to each corner of the Persian realm. It remains a prestigious military office.
translation: 这个头衔通常意味着军队领袖，可追溯至阿契美尼德王朝，在萨珊帝国中有四位薛波勃分派到帝国的各个角落，它一直是种地位显赫的军事要职。

original: As the minister of the magazines, it is the responsibility of the Eran Ambaragbed to see to the arms and armaments of the realm's warriors.
translation: 作为军备库的总管，伊兰阿巴格负责全国战士的军械装备。

original:
I trust you are in good health, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. My name is Palnatoke, and I have taken it upon myself to create a brotherhood of warriors devoted to Thor and Odin. While sailing along the coast of Stettin, I discovered the perfect site to build our stronghold and I would ask your permission to settle this land.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
translation:
[Root.GetTitledFirstName]阁下，祝您健康。我叫帕纳托克，我致力于组建一个为索尔与奥丁献身的勇士兄弟会。在斯德丁的海滨航行时，我发现了一个建设据点的绝佳地址，我请求您能让我使用那片土地。

此致，
[From.GetTitledName]

original: By all means, build your castle.
translation: 无论如何，建造你的城堡吧。

original: No, I want no troublemakers in my land.
translation: 不，我不希望在我的地盘上看到任何麻烦。

original: The Vikings under Palnatoke have finished their stronghold in [Root.Location.GetName] and the warrior brotherhood have established it as their headquarters. Henceforth the new castle shall be known as Jomsborg.
translation: 帕那托克领导的维京人在[Root.Location.GetName]建立了城堡，兄弟会作为其总部。这座城堡将被称为约姆斯堡。

original: A band of fierce Vikings have established a warrior brotherhood in [From.Location.GetName] along the Baltic coast. Based in a castle known as Jomsborg, these Jomsvikings are devoted to Thor, Odin and the other Norse gods. They brook no quarter on the battlefield and will permit only the strongest and ablest warriors amongst their number.\n\nThough there are those who would dismiss them as simple brigands, the Jomsvikings have vowed to defend all Norse lands being encroached by Christendom or other foreign religions.
translation: 一群凶猛的维京人在位于波罗的海沿岸的[From.Location.GetName]建立了城堡。扎根于那个被称作约姆斯堡的城堡，约姆斯维京人崇拜索尔和奥丁以及其他的北欧诸神。他们在战场上毫不迟疑，只允许最强壮和最能干的勇士加入。\n\n虽然有人视为山贼一样清除它们，但约姆斯维京人誓要捍卫北欧的土地。

original: Their place in Valhalla is assured.
Let us hope those zealots steer clear of us.
translation: 但愿这些狂热者离我们远点。

original:
I trust you are in good health, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. My name is Palnatoke, and I have taken it upon myself to create a brotherhood of warriors devoted to Thor and Odin. While sailing along the coast of Wolgast, I discovered the perfect site to build our stronghold and I would ask your permission to settle this land.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
translation:
[Root.GetTitledFirstName]阁下，祝您健康。我叫帕纳托克，我致力于组建一个为索尔与奥丁献身的勇士兄弟会。在沃尔加斯特的海滨航行时，我发现了一个建设据点的绝佳地址，我请求您能让我使用那片土地。

此致，
[From.GetTitledName]

original: The person that this title is bestowed upon is considered to be the Champion of the Realm. There is surely no greater honor for mortal men to aspire to.
translation: 该称号的所有者被视为王国的捍卫者，毫无疑问这个头衔很让人向往。

original: The Master of the Blade is a prestigious honorific usually granted to those with demonstrated ability in swordsmanship.
translation: 剑术大师这个很受尊敬的称呼只授予那些剑术卓越的人。

original: The Master of the Bow is a prestigious honorific usually granted to those with demonstrated ability in bowmanship.
translation: 弓术大师这个很受尊敬的称呼只授予那些弓术卓越的人。

original: This honorific can only be granted to those who have reached the age of fifty. Their wisdom and the sorely needed guidance they offer the younger generations is deserving of great respect.
translation: 这个称号只能授予50岁以上的人。他们的智慧以及对青年人的引导理应获得尊称。

original: Have your priests sacrifice [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to the gods.
translation: 要你的祭司把[Root.GetTitledFirstName]献祭给神灵。

original: Your priests have sacrificed [From.GetTitledName] to the gods! After bringing [From.GetHerHim] to one of our new temple pyramids, the priests placed [From.GetFirstName] on an altar and sliced [From.GetHerHim] open with a ceremonial dagger. They then tore out [From.GetHerHis] still beating heart to the cheers of your assembled warriors.
translation: 你的祭司将[From.GetTitledName]献祭给了神灵！在把[From.GetHerHim]带到我们一个新的神庙金字塔后，祭司们把[From.GetFirstName]放在圣坛上，用祭祀匕首把[From.GetHerHim]剖开。他们扯出[From.GetHerHis]还在跳动的心脏，引来你那些聚会的勇士们阵阵欢呼。

original: This land now belongs to us.
translation: 这片土地现在属于我了。

original: A small gift from us. Think nothing of it.
translation: 我们的小意思而已，别想太多。

original: These Easterners spread disease like vermin!
translation: 那些东方人向寄生虫一样散播疾病！

original: In time, their empire will crumble before us.
translation: 他们的帝国会先于我们崩溃。

original: It is well to see things becoming more like home.
translation: 一切都越来越像家乡，太好了。

original: The mere sight of [From.GetTitledFirstName] fills you with contempt. Challenge the cur to holmgang, a single combat duel, to finally settle your differences once and for all.
translation: 仅仅看见[From.GetTitledFirstName]就让你充满蔑视。挑战这只恶狗去进行小岛决斗，一劳永逸地解决你们的分歧。

original: Yes, I will issue the challenge!

That mad dog [From.GetTitledFirstName] has somehow summoned up the courage to challenge you to holmgang! If you accept, you and [From.GetFirstName] will meet in single combat on a small islet. If you refuse this duel, it will be seen as a stain upon your honor.
translation: 那条疯狗[From.GetTitledFirstName]不知为何鼓起勇气向你单挑小岛决斗！如果你接受了，你将和[From.GetFirstName]在一个小岛上单打独斗！如果你拒绝了，这将成为你人生上的污点。

original: I... I need not prove myself against that fool.
translation: 我不需要通过揍个疯子来证明自己。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] sends word that he accepts your challenge! One week from now, the two of you shall meet in combat. There is no turning back at this point.
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]来信说他接受你的挑战！一个星期后你们将决斗，已经没有回头路了。

original: The coward [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to refuse your challenge and will not face you in holmgang! At least now the spineless fool's utter lack of honor has been exposed for all to see.
translation: 那个懦夫[From.GetTitledFirstName]拒绝了你的挑战！现在大家都知道他是个没骨气的孬种了。

original: It is still dawn when you meet [From.GetTitledFirstName] on the small islet chosen for the holmgang. Surrounded by witnesses, you grab your shield and axe while your opponent does the same. After hurling insults at each other for a few minutes, the battle is finally joined!
translation: 黄昏中你在决斗的小岛上看到了[From.GetTitledFirstName]。在众多目光的注视下，你和你的对手都紧握着盾牌举起了斧头。在几分钟的骂战后，决斗开始了！

original: My axe will carve you a new smile!
translation: 让我的斧头给你刻个笑脸！

original: With a mighty blow from your axe, you split your opponent's shield in half. Without a shield to hide behind, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] desperately swings his axe at your face. Though you quickly pull away, you can feel blood trickling down your face. Annoyed, you charge at [FromFrom.GetFirstName] and inflict several wounds before he yields.
translation: 在一次猛击下你的斧头劈开了对手的盾牌。没有了盾牌的[FromFrom.GetFirstName]绝望地在你面前挥舞着斧头。虽然你很快闪开了，但还是感到有血从你脸上留下来。愤怒的你在[FromFrom.GetFirstName]投降前狠狠地给了他几下重击。

original: With a mighty blow from your axe, you split your opponent's shield in half. Without a shield to hide behind, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] desperately swings his axe at your face. Though you quickly pull away, you can feel blood trickling down your face from a gash. Annoyed, you land one final blow on [FromFrom.GetFirstName] and cleave his head with your axe.
translation: 在一次猛击下你的斧头劈开了对手的盾牌。没有了盾牌的[FromFrom.GetFirstName]绝望地在你面前挥舞着斧头。虽然你很快闪开了，但还是感到有血从你脸上留下来。愤怒的你对[FromFrom.GetFirstName]发出致命一击把他的头砍了下来。

original: [FromFrom.GetFirstName] immediately charges at you with his axe, but you deftly deflect his blows with your shield. You bash him with it several times in the face, and he staggers backwards in pain. Before he can fully recover, you catch him with several swings of your axe and he yields.
translation: [FromFrom.GetFirstName]迅速对你展开攻击，但你用盾牌挡住了他的斧头。你对他的面部对进行了几次打击，他在痛苦中摇晃着倒了下来。在他缓过来之前，被你用斧头猛揍了一顿，他投降了。

original: [FromFrom.GetFirstName] immediately hurls himself at you, but you block his flurry of blows with your shield. You use it to heave him in an arc over your shoulder, and as he sails towards the ground behind you, you swiftly turn around and connect the blade of your axe with his throat. [FromFrom.GetFirstName] is dead before he hits the ground - a clean kill.
translation: [FromFrom.GetFirstName]迅速对你展开攻击，但你用盾牌挡住了他的斧头。你用盾把他扛过肩头，等他摔向你身后的地面时，你很快地转过身来用斧头划过了他的喉咙。[FromFrom.GetFirstName]在他掉在地上前就死了——一次完美的杀戮。

original: You bang your axe against your shield several times and set off towards [FromFrom.GetFirstName] with a mighty battle cry. As you draw near, the color seems to drain from your opponent's face and he drops his shield and axe with a terrified shriek. He leaps into the water and swims away from the islet, his frail nerves having failed him.
translation: 你用斧头敲击了几下盾牌后嘶吼着朝[FromFrom.GetFirstName]奔去。当你靠近时，你的对手面无血色连斧头和盾牌都掉了，只剩下惊恐的尖叫。他赶紧跳到水里游离了小岛，他的胆小从不失败。

original: You and your opponent launch yourselves upon one another, and wood splinters fly in every direction as axe connects with shield. You seem evenly matched, and the fighting drags on. When the sun begins to set, you are both bleeding from multiple wounds and neither of you can stand upright. The duel is declared a draw.
translation: 你们将斧头挥向对方，盾牌的碎屑四处飞散。你们看起来势均力敌，战斗持续着。直到夕阳西下，你们两个都已经站不起来了。这场决斗是平局。

original: As [FromFrom.GetFirstName] advances on you menacingly with his shield and axe held ready, you are overcome with a terror the likes of which you have never before experienced. Tossing your weapons aside, you run in blind panic towards the water and leap into it with the only goal of getting off the islet alive.
translation: [FromFrom.GetFirstName]握好了斧头和盾牌来势汹汹，你正经历着从未体验过的恐怖。你丢下武器惶恐地跳下了水里，你唯一的目标就是快逃命。

original: The better part of valor! The better part of valor!
translation: 小心即大勇！小心即大勇！

original: The battle begins and you swing at [FromFrom.GetFirstName], but he manages to block you at the last instant and your axe plants itself firmly in his shield. As you struggle to pull it free, your opponent lands a heavy blow with his own weapon in your flank. Wounded, you collapse to the ground with no choice but to yield.
translation: 决斗开始了你举起武器挥向[FromFrom.GetFirstName]，但最后一刻他却挡住了你的攻击，你的斧头深深地嵌入他的盾牌中。你想把斧子拔出来，却遭到了对手的侧面进攻。你受伤倒下了，只得投降。

original: The battle begins and you swing at [FromFrom.GetFirstName], but he manages to block you at the last instant and your axe plants itself firmly in his shield. As you struggle to pull it free, your opponent lands a heavy blow with his own weapon in your flank. Badly maimed, you collapse to the ground with no choice but to yield.
translation: 决斗开始了，你举起武器挥向[FromFrom.GetFirstName]，但最后一刻他却挡住了你的攻击，你的斧头深深地嵌入他的盾牌中。你想把斧子拔出来，却遭到了对手的侧面进攻。你受到了致残的伤害，只得投降。

original: The battle begins and you swing at [FromFrom.GetFirstName], but he manages to block you at the last instant and your axe plants itself firmly in his shield. As you struggle to pull it free, there is a sharp pain and you look down only to find your opponent's axe buried deep inside your gut. You sink to your knees as darkness overtakes you...
translation: 决斗开始了，你举起武器挥向[FromFrom.GetFirstName]，但最后一刻他却挡住了你的攻击，你的斧头深深地嵌入他的盾牌中。你想把斧子拔出来，却感到剧烈的疼痛，低头一看对手的斧子已经砍进肠子里去了。你慢慢杵在地上，黑暗将你吞噬……

original: It is still dawn when you meet [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] on the small islet chosen for the holmgang. Surrounded by witnesses, you grab your shield and axe while your opponent does the same. After hurling insults at each other for a few minutes, the battle is finally joined!
translation: 黄昏中你在决斗的小岛上看到了[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]。在众多目光的注视下，你和你的对手都紧握着盾牌举起了斧头。在几分钟的骂战后，决斗开始了！

You use it to heave him in an arc over your shoulder, and as he sails towards the ground behind you, you swiftly turn around and connect the blade of your axe with his throat. [From.GetFirstName] is dead before he hits the ground - a clean kill.

As you struggle to pull it free, there is a sharp pain and you look down only to find your opponent's axe buried deep inside your gut. You sink to your knees as darkness overtakes you...
